---
applyTo: "**"
description: Copilot extension tool usage guidelines
---

# Tool Usage
- ALWAYS use the built-in Copilot extension tools instead of corresponding their terminal commands, to avoid manual authorization, and for more efficient integration with the IDE

## Tool Usage Guidelines
- create_directory: instead of mkdir (macOS/Linux/Windows)
- create_file: instead of touch (macOS/Linux) or echo > (macOS/Linux/Windows) or New-Item (Windows PowerShell)
- create_new_jupyter_notebook: instead of jupyter notebook (macOS/Linux/Windows)
- create_new_workspace: instead of manual project setup commands
- edit_notebook_file: instead of jupyter nbconvert or manual editing
- fetch_webpage: instead of curl (macOS/Linux) or wget (macOS/Linux) or Invoke-WebRequest (Windows)
- file_search: instead of find (macOS/Linux) or dir /s (Windows)
- grep_search: instead of grep (macOS/Linux) or findstr (Windows)
- get_changed_files: instead of git diff (macOS/Linux/Windows)
- get_errors: instead of manual error checking
- copilot_getNotebookSummary: instead of jupyter nbconvert --to script
- get_project_setup_info: instead of manual setup
- get_search_view_results: instead of manual search
- get_vscode_api: instead of manual API lookup
- github_repo: instead of git clone (macOS/Linux/Windows)
- install_extension: instead of code --install-extension (macOS/Linux/Windows)
- list_code_usages: instead of grep -r or manual search
- list_dir: instead of ls (macOS/Linux) or dir (Windows)
- open_simple_browser: instead of open (macOS) or xdg-open (Linux) or start (Windows)
- read_file: instead of cat (macOS/Linux) or type (Windows)
- replace_string_in_file: instead of sed (macOS/Linux) or manual editing
- run_notebook_cell: instead of jupyter run
- run_vscode_command: instead of manual command execution
- semantic_search: instead of manual search
- test_failure: instead of manual test running
- vscode_searchExtensions_internal: instead of manual extension search
- configure_python_environment: instead of python -m venv or conda create
- create_and_run_task: instead of manual task creation
- get_python_environment_details: instead of python --version or conda info
- get_python_executable_details: instead of which python or where python
- get_terminal_output: instead of manual terminal interaction
- install_python_packages: instead of pip install (macOS/Linux/Windows)
- mcp_copilot_conta_act_container: instead of docker start/stop/restart/rm
- mcp_copilot_conta_act_image: instead of docker pull/rmi
- mcp_copilot_conta_inspect_container: instead of docker inspect
- mcp_copilot_conta_inspect_image: instead of docker inspect
- mcp_copilot_conta_list_containers: instead of docker ps
- mcp_copilot_conta_list_images: instead of docker images
- mcp_copilot_conta_list_networks: instead of docker network ls
- mcp_copilot_conta_list_volumes: instead of docker volume ls
- mcp_copilot_conta_logs_for_container: instead of docker logs
- mcp_copilot_conta_prune: instead of docker system prune
- mcp_copilot_conta_run_container: instead of docker run
- mcp_copilot_conta_tag_image: instead of docker tag

- runTests: instead of pytest (macOS/Linux/Windows)
- mcp_pylance_mcp_s_pylanceRunCodeSnippet: instead of python -c or python script.py (macOS/Linux/Windows)

## Terminal Commands
**CRITICAL: Never prefix terminal commands with `cd` - all `run_in_terminal` commands execute from the workspace root directory automatically.**
